text: I think this hasn’t been translated. <https://fi.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kirkasvalokuuloke>

attachments.title: Kirkasvalokuuloke
attachments.text: Kirkasvalokuulokkeella eli korvavalolla tarkoitetaan suomalaisen Valkee Oy:n kehittämää laitetta, jossa kahden led-valon avulla johdetaan kirkasvaloa korvakäytävän kautta aivojen valovasteellisille alueille. Yhtiön ja Oulun yliopiston tekemien kontrolloitujen kliinisten tutkimusten mukaan 12 minuutin kirkasvalohoito 1–3 kertaa vuorokaudessa lievittää aikaerorasituksen ja kaamosmasennuksen oireita.

text:
“Transcranial bright light treatment via the ear
canals in seasonal affective disorder: a randomized,
double-blind dose-response study”
<https://www.humancharger.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/09/Transcranial-bright-light-treatment-via-ear-canals-in-SAD-a-randomized-controlled-double-blind-dose-response-study.pdf|https://www.humancharger.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/09/Transcranial-bright-light-treat[…]randomized-controlled-double-blind-dose-response-study.pdf>

elements.text:
“Transcranial bright light treatment via the ear
canals in seasonal affective disorder: a randomized,
double-blind dose-response study”

text: That’s from the wikipedia page, more studies are there too.

elements.text: That’s from the wikipedia page, more studies are there too.

text: “Conclusions: These results suggests that transcranial bright light treatment may have antidepressant and anxiolytic effect in SAD patients, as both self- and psychiatrist-rated depressive and anxiety symptoms decreased in all treatment groups. These improvements are comparable to findings of earlier bright light studies that used conventional devices. The lack of dose response may be due to a saturation effect above a certain light intensity threshold. Further studies on the effects of transcranial bright light with an adequate placebo condition are needed.”

elements.text: “Conclusions: These results suggests that transcranial bright light treatment may have antidepressant and anxiolytic effect in SAD patients, as both self- and psychiatrist-rated depressive and anxiety symptoms decreased in all treatment groups. These improvements are comparable to findings of earlier bright light studies that used conventional devices. The lack of dose response may be due to a saturation effect above a certain light intensity threshold. Further studies on the effects of transcranial bright light with an adequate placebo condition are needed.”
